pageProduct.name: Ostelin Cal-DK2 - Calcium & Vitamin D - 60 Tablets
pageProduct.description:
Information

Ostelin Cal-DK2

Optimised calcium delivery

Ostelin Cal-DK2 provides optimised calcium delivery into the bones in a convenient 1-a-day dose of Calcium, Vitamin D3 and Vitamin K2. Each tablet contains Calcium (as carbonate) 800mg, Colecalciferol 25 micrograms (1000IU) and Menaquinone-7 180 micrograms.

Ostelin Cal-DK2 is formulated for those who:

  • • Are at risk of Vitamin D, Vitamin K or Calcium insufficiency
  • • Identify as older adults/postmenopausal women
  • • Are wanting to support healthy bones

      • Did you know?

      Vitamin K2 assists in the function of proteins that are important for bone development and influences the transportation of calcium in the body.

Ostelin Cal-DK2 Ingredients

Calcium

Calcium helps reduce bone density loss in pregnant, post-menopausal and elderly women.

Vitamin D

High strength vitamin D3 promotes calcium absorption, and a diet deficient in calcium can lead to osteoporosis in later stages of life.

Vitamin K2

Vitamin K2 activates osteocalcin, a protein that regulates calcium, which is essential for bone mineralisation.

Bone health across life stages

Infancy

For infants, the most important factor in the development of a potential vitamin D insufficiency is their mother's vitamin D status. Generally, breast milk is low in vitamin D.

Infants who are breast-fed and dark-skinned may require vitamin D supplementation to maintain adequate vitamin D nutrition.

Children & Adolescents

Calcium is essential in youth and throughout life to maximise and strengthen bones. It increases bone mineral density and assists normal healthy bone development in teenagers.

Bone mass increases about seven-fold from birth to puberty, and half of a person's bone mass is accumulated during adolescence.

Adults

Sufficient dietary calcium is needed to maintain bone mass.

Up until around the age of 30, the body creates bone faster than it is broken down. After age 30, this balance changes and more bone is lost than is gained.

Elderly

During menopause there is a decline in calcium absorption and increase in calcium loss. Aging affects Vitamin D synthesis in the skin.

Adequate intake of dietary calcium is critical in reducing the rate of bone loss associated with aging and may assist in the prevention of osteoporosis.

General Information

Ostelin Cal-DK2 for optimised calcium delivery.

Ostelin Cal-DK2 provides optimal delivery of calcium into the bones with a convenient 1-a-day dose. Cal-DK2 contains calcium, which helps reduce bone density loss in pregnant, post-menopausal and elderly women. It also contains high strength vitamin D3, which promotes calcium absorption. Vitamin K2 activates Osteocalcin, a protein that regulates calcium which is essential for bone mineralisation. A diet deficient in calcium can lead to osteoporosis in later life.

Suitable For: 66% of Australians over the age of 50 have poor bone health. Calcium balance is regulated by a number of hormones and proteins, including osteocalcin and matrix Gla-protein.
K2 activates the proteins osteocalcin and matrix-Glaprotein, which are important for bone health. Vitamin D is essential for calcium absorption from the intestine.
This product suits Australians over the age of 50 who:
Are wanting to support healthy bones.
Are at risk of Vitamin D, Vitamin K or Calcium deficiency.
May be older adults or postmenopausal women

Boxed Contents: 185ML

Size: 60 Pack

Warnings

Vitamin supplements should not replace a balanced diet. Do not take while on warfarin therapy without medical advice. Warning: large tablet size.

CAUTION

Vitamin supplements should not replace a balanced diet. Do not take while on warfarin therapy without medical advice.

IMPORTANT INFORMATION

No Added: Yeast, gluten, lactose, artificial colours, flavours or preservatives, or dairy products.

Ingredients

Vitamin K2 180mcg, (menaquinone-7 as K2VITAL Delta)
Calcium (as carbonate) 800mg, D 1000iu
Vitamin D3 1000IU (colecalciferol 25mcg)
